Reviews.Title: Love this phone!
Reviews.Author: A. R. Shirah
Reviews.Content: So I read a lot of bad reviews before getting this phone and I'm glad i didn't listen. I love this phone so much. I only download the apps that I know I'm going to use. It's a low-end android phone so it should be viewed as such. But here are the things you CAN DO on this phone:*Watch Videos*Surf the web (Bing comes with the phone, i heard some bad reviewers dis-liking this, but all you have to do is download GOOGLE for free. I have both)*take video & pictures & share instantly on facebook/twitter/email*Text*play games*talkCONS*I am a 31 yr old woman and can type on this phone easily. However if you have big fingers/hands, this has a tiny screen and will probably be a problem for you.* I do wish this phone was a little bigger when surfing the net.PROS:Price (free with verizon)touch screen works flawlesslyMany accessories to choose fromAndroid 2.1 network works greatVideo clarityVoice functions (you can tell it to call someone and it has worked perfect everytime.)

Reviews.Title: Best Deal EVER!!
Reviews.Author: loyaltii11
Reviews.Content: I love my phone. I was sceptical at first, buying a used phone for so cheap... but it works amazing. I haven't had any problems with it and i've had it for a few months now. it's an android phone... so i can dowload all the applications that i want. Best deal i have had in a long time. :)

Reviews.Title: Very Marginal Smartphone
Reviews.Author: Poogy
Reviews.Content: I broke my Droid (the original one) and since the phone I wanted to replace it with wasn't going to be available for a month and I needed an interim phone, I purchased this one, as the least expensive smartphone Verizon had available.  Wow, I had no idea anyone made smartphones this poorly.Does it "work"?  Sure.  You can call on it, send and receive emails, take photos, surf the web, download apps.  Yes, it works.  But compared to my two and a half year old Droid, the screen is tiny, the keyboard fit for only very small hands pecking very carefully, the browser is slow to load, everything is cramped and difficult to read, the sound quality when playing back mp3s or videos is poor (including when listening with headphones), and the operating system is antiquated. It's a little like comparing an Atari videogame from the 1980s to the current state of the art, or using a computer running an ancient operating system.I understand that not everyone needs, or can afford, a top of the line smartphone.  However, the additional cost of a phone that's substantially easier to use--larger screen, faster, more up to date software--really isn't that much.  So I recommend anyone shopping for a smartphone, even someone who wants something basic, to spend just a little more.  It'll be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Citrus Phone
Reviews.Author: Gayl
Reviews.Content: I really like the look and size of this phone, it is perfect for sliding into my pocket.  The only drawback is that the keyboard is very touchy. Otherwise, great little phone.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: goodkarma
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace my older Motorola Citrus that I had used and abused.  I love my old one so much that I wanted another one!! I love it!! The size is perfect to me, it is a small phone and easily fits into a pocket or small purse without much bulk.  It is very easy to use and does everything that I need it to do such as mobile banking , facebook, etsy etc.... Very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Crippled, but works with Page Plus
Reviews.Author: Matthew Elvey "tech whiz"
Reviews.Content: The version of Android on this device has been messed with; it's got a number of features that have been tweaked to ONLY work over the cellular network data connection, not over Wi-Fi.For example, I if I tell it to "Navigate to San Francisco," it won't do it.  The navigation function only works if Wi-Fi is turned off.  This is by design - Verizon has crippled the phone.  It's not anBut it took no special effort to use on Page Plus.  I just signed up with them, and they enabled OTA (Over The Air) programming.

Reviews.Title: Based on how I use the phone
Reviews.Author: Keng
Reviews.Content: This phone was my first foray into the android arena... I am not a heavy phone user and my needs are very simple.  for the most part I like this phone and it meets my immediate needs.Profile... Fits in my front shirt pocket or pants pocket quite comfortably. easy to pop the back off to access the battery or insert memory card.Keyboard...  I can type a message on the virtual keyboard without fat fingering the other keys. (medium sized hands)email... easy to set up and sync with many different types of accounts.  I had issues with my godaddy account, but a free application in the android marketplace solved that problem.Web... I don't do much web surfing on the phone other than to look up addresses and phone numbers.  This phone is OK for that.Blue-tooth... music streaming works flawlessly in my car but the sound quality varies.  I am not sure if it is because of the quality of the music file or issues with the bluetooth hardware in the phone; but it does come in at cd quality for the most part.  Voice quality is decent based on what people on the receiving end tell me, but when calls come in, they are frequently interrupted with static and garbled popping noise (it's not my speakers).Music Player... I use spotify and the application works perfectly; the built in music player also works great for playing music as well.performance.... This phone is average when it comes to performance.  It is prone to lag and will randomly stall.  It doesn't happen often, but then again I am not a heavy phone user.  Battery life is just ok... do not expect it to last longer than a day if you have wifi / gps turned on.Overall assessment.  Decent phone for the $$$ that I will probably keep for awhile provided nothing happens to it.

Reviews.Title: Great phone but
Reviews.Author: Run Lickety Split "Rockin 64"
Reviews.Content: It is a great little phone but some of the apps on Google Play aren't compatible with this phone & it doesn't have very much memory so you can't add many apps no matter how much space is on the micro SD card.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE!
Reviews.Author: Liv
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE!!!!! I liked it when I first got it but now it cuts off during the middle of a conversation or a text.  It has not been a year yet.  I have it in a protective case so it has not been damaged by dropping it.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone.
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a bit skepttable but ordered two anyway. When I got them I was glad I did. I have had no issues with either one.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone Buy For The Price Range
Reviews.Author: Maria Lankford
Reviews.Content: This is my first smart phone and I didn't want to put a lot of money into something I wasn't sure about.  However since I bought it I love it.  It is a good "first" smart phone for someone who is trying to step up.  The only draw backs are that it has a small screen; would have prefered a larger screen and sometimes the phone freezes up.  I did download an app that will clean it periodically which did help with that.  Other than that it has been a good phone for what I paid for it and I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: anterrio howard
Reviews.Content: Because phone came before expect time phone worked great and had extra battery and back cover I loved it the phone was great.

Reviews.Title: #@$%&^!  phone dont buy!!
Reviews.Author: Karina
Reviews.Content: Terrible phone. you need an app to keep the mobile data turned off. Then the processor cant handle much so it is always shutting down. Absolutely the most aweful phone I have ever owned. Returned it. It shouldn't even be called a smart phone.

Reviews.Title: If I could rate it less than a 1, I would.
Reviews.Author: Kells1973 "Kay"
Reviews.Content: Never could get a signal on the phone; therefore, I could not program or anything. Waste of my time and money. If you are thinking about purchasing this phone DON'T. Piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: rkruse3
Reviews.Content: this phone is great....it does everything i want it to do...i am greatfully happy to get this phone.....5 stars ...to all that looking at this phone if u have big fingers i might not be the phone for u but they do sell the touch screen pens for the phone also...no problem with the phone at all

Reviews.Title: Just too cheap.
Reviews.Author: jessonthebeach
Reviews.Content: Not worth it. It never does what I want and constantly pushes it's own buttons. I've accidentally called so many people because the phone keeps doing it's own thing. Either stick with a dumb phone or get a good smart phone. I've learned these $40 smartphones are just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Phone was still connected
Reviews.Author: Scarlett Villarreal "Scarlett"
Reviews.Content: Got this phone for my daughter, tried to connect it to my service provider, but the phone had an out standing balance of thousand dollars. Will never buy a cell phone online again.

Reviews.Title: PIECE OF S***, PILE OF JUNK
Reviews.Author: Young health fan
Reviews.Content: stopped charging today (11/14/2013).  the phone has been acting up for a while now and now it finally stopped charging.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Toe W. Griffiths
Reviews.Content: it working greatthere is no problem with it so far.it has very nice picture and it voice connection is good

Reviews.Title: works as expected.
Reviews.Author: GEORGE M LIN
Reviews.Content: phone works, delivered fast, service also good (came with bad charger and got replacement quickly), only downside is battery does not last long, need to charge ofter, but no complaint.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad
Reviews.Author: Laudy
Reviews.Content: Was a little disappointed when I tried to take a photo. The SD card was missing. No manual or any contact information was included from the actual seller.

Reviews.Title: Love it..
Reviews.Author: nikki000
Reviews.Content: My son love it. I purchased this for his phone in it works wonderful. So he want damage his screen..

Reviews.Title: this phone sucks
Reviews.Author: Cassandra Morrison
Reviews.Content: however got my phone on time.  but this phone is garbage. works but slow and extra extra no service ANYWHERE.  SO DONT BRAKE YOUR PHONE!

Reviews.Title: Horrible phone
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I only bought it because it was cheap and I only needed for a  few weeks while my phone is being repaired. But if you're seriously thinking about buying it for long term use my advice to you is don't. I don't even use it. It's a hassle to try to type. The keyboard disappears and types thing you didn't even come close to typing. It's slow, unresponsive. It's horrible. You can't download instagram or snapchat because it still says android market. You can't update to google play. Just buy something else. I recommend one of the first droid phones from Motorola because they're cheap as well

Reviews.Title: Enjoying  it!
Reviews.Author: Dorothy
Reviews.Content: i love this phone,and as soon as i learn all the features of it iwould give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Motorola citrus WX445
Reviews.Author: barnone
Reviews.Content: I bought this in July and now doesn't work......white screen turns on and off without touching it.Is there a warantee for replace or repair.

Reviews.Title: fantastic
Reviews.Author: nic
Reviews.Content: This phone is great for the price. Sender got it to me very quickly. No complaints. Will definately purchase from this place again.

Reviews.Title: Pretty disappointed
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Foster "Mind Bender"
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for a few months now and I am ready to replace it. The keyboard sucks. You can't type anything without touching other touch screens and must delete your message and start over again. The browser is huge and does not allow for full viewing, you must shrink it down. Athough it is full of apps and abilities which I am impressed with, I find it difficult to get to those places. I want a simpler phone.

Reviews.Title: The worst android ive ever sold
Reviews.Author: Tagehl
Reviews.Content: My customer had to send it back for repair after one week. Motorola didnt repair it correctly. My customer was so dissatisfied he threw it in the trash

Reviews.Title: Mediocre
Reviews.Author: D. Bartley "Yeah"
Reviews.Content: I've never been big on the whole Smartphone craze, I only use cellphones to text and make short phone calls (Do we need milk?) so I never saw a big point in them, but as that is where the world is ending up, and I needed a new phone I figured I'd get one of the cheaper smart phones and settled with this one.It works fine for my use, but I do wish the keys while typing were a little larger, sometimes while even actively trying to hit a letter I'll end up selecting a different letter. And I wish the question mark was on the main keyboard instead of having to shift for it all the time. I had a full fledged qwerty keyboard on my last phone in which the question mark was on its own key, and got use to it, so its a minor annoyance for me.For the heck of it I decided to download some games, the phone itself works fine with basic games but it was so slow with a game like Fruit Ninja that I couldn't even play it.For the first month the battery life was fine. I would have to plug it in every few days like any other phone, but after about a month the battery life dropped amazingly. A full charge would only last until about 12 in the afternoon, and that was with little-to-no use. A few texts here and there and checking the time every now and then.  I deleted some apps and put the phone on Battery Saver mode and that seemed to fix it. . .for a few days. . . where it went right back to needing to be charged everyday.I'm fully willing to chalk it up to the battery life being the case of just a lemon though.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely horrible phone
Reviews.Author: AK musher
Reviews.Content: This was my first smart phone from Verizon Wireless. Using it is the equivalent of using a Dell with Windows 95 on it. It is slow, locks up, presses the wrong keys, doesn't connect to the internet - overall it is a worthless piece of crap. It may have something to do with Verizon lying and saying they have service up here in Alaska in order for me to purchase this expensive phone. Needless to say, I cancelled my service and they are still charging me the $250 cancellation fee, even though you can't even type in my ZIP code on their web site because they don't have service here. I look forward with utter childlike anticipation to throwing my Motorola Citrus off the highest bridge over the biggest river around. It is going to feel sooooo good!

Reviews.Title: This was the worst purchase I ever made on Amazon.
Reviews.Author: Matthew McLeod
Reviews.Content: The product was worn beyond belief and came without several essential items such as a recharging cord.  The only reason that I did not return it was because the time window elapsed.  I still regret purchasing it.

Reviews.Title: Wow what a phone
Reviews.Author: Chewy
Reviews.Content: I had problems with this phone since the first time i turned it on. I'm not dramatic so i'm dropping the subject, I guess that's what i get for buying a used phone with noe 411 on the info.
